greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Primes from the decimal expansion of Pi, sorted first by the final digit index and then by length.
comment: In this sequence, primes are listed each time they occur (again) with a new ending position, in contrast to A198019 where only the first occurrence of each prime is listed. - _M. F. Hasler_, Sep 02 2013
example: The first digit is 3, which is prime, so a(1) = 3.
The second digit is 1, which is no prime, but 31 is prime, so a(2) = 31.
The third digit is 4, which does not end any prime.
The fourth digit is 1, not prime, but 41 is prime, so a(3) = 41.
results.author: _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Oct 21 2011
